greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Mirror image of the Golden Triangle: T(n,k) = A001654(n-k) for n>=0 and 0<=k<=n.
comment: This triangle is the mirror image of the Golden Triangle A180662. The terms in the n-th row of the triangle are the first (n+1) golden rectangle numbers in reversed order. The golden rectangle numbers are A001654(n)=F(n)*F(n+1), with F(n) the Fibonacci numbers.

The chess sums, see A180662 for their definitions, mirror those of the Golden Triangle: Row1 & Row1; Row 2 & Row2; Kn1 and Kn2; Kn3 and Kn4; Fi1 and Fi2; Ca1 and Ca2; Ca3 and Ca4; Gi1 and Gi2; Gi3 and Gi4; Ze1 and Ze2; Ze3 and Ze4.
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Rows n = 0..120 of triangle, flattened
formula: T(n,k) = F(n-k)*F(n-k+1) with F(n) = A000045(n), for n>=0 and 0<=k<=n.
example: The first few rows of this triangle are:
maple: seq(seq(T(n,k), k=0..n), n=0..10); # revised _Johannes W. Meijer_, Sep 13 2012
xref: Cf. A180662 (Golden Triangle), A001654 (Golden Rectangle numbers), A000045 (F(n)).
results.author: _Johannes W. Meijer_, Sep 21 2010
